metadata.title: CVE-2017-17498 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
WritePNMImage in coders/pnm.c in GraphicsMagick 1.3.26 allows remoteattackers to cause a denial of service (bit_stream.cMagickBitStreamMSBWrite heap-based buffer overflow and application crash)or possibly have unspecified other impact via a crafted file.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-17498` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

graphicsmagick - 1.3.18-1ubuntu3.1+esm5
graphicsmagick-imagemagick-compat - 1.3.18-1ubuntu3.1+esm5
libgraphics-magick-perl - 1.3.18-1ubuntu3.1+esm5
libgraphicsmagick++3 - 1.3.18-1ubuntu3.1+esm5
libgraphicsmagick3 - 1.3.18-1ubuntu3.1+esm5
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: graphicsmagick package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.3.18-1ubuntu3.1+esm5').
